column5: Made it to the shack on Edward around 1 and fished till 3:30.After drilling one hole and turning heat I got my 4 eaters again in like 5 minutes.Great bite till 3 and tapered off.Used 4 minnows on my eaters and then switched to a small vibrato and caught a dozen plus before switching to a hair jig given to me from Bill Krejca.Got 4 small 1/16 oz and tried those 4 again today.tried 2 different colors and that didn't matter.Used 1/4 oz split shot to get it down.Id stop the weight 4 ft from bottom and I could see jig very slowly go down on its own and then walleye would rise and take it.Would say the 2 I used caught well over 40 walleyes without bait.Thx Bill those are awesome.I packed up and headed home when it slowed.Had my excitement for the day.Check out last two pics.We have a lot of snow.
John - Good to see you did well. Tol' ja, I'm not surprised! Bill
There were quite a few walleýe moving through steady for a while.great action.
Nice pictures thanks for update on snow. Glad to see how much is up there with hopes of water levels being higher this spring.
Lots of snow and morè coming today again.Water will come up some for this spring.Lots of the snow evaporates and never gets in the lakes but there will be run off
Have my fingers crossed that I can get my boat to my dock. Lake level was a pain last year but we were glad to be back up there.
Would be nice with higher water.I had problems launching my boat especially the dock in Vermilion Bay.Cliff lake got bad and I got stuck there.
